is they gave them a set a series of 60 images and within those images 50% of

humans can identify real images with the rate of about eighty percent which is
fairly poor in my opinion but then when we start talking about images that had been actually manipulated what we're actually going to find in deep fake

a rate of forty percent so we can't rely on humans to detect deep fakes
unfortunately so that army of human analysts that you are going to deploy tech defects is not going to work
luckily there are a number of methodologies that we can use to detect defects and a bunch of these
methodologies have actually already existed in the image forensic realm so
one of those ways is looking at the signal level and what we're talking about here are properties that are
inherent to the image itself so for example if image had been compressed using a double JPEG compression for
example that's usually a red flag that that image has been manipulated in some ways same things if we go and say find
like artifacts left behind by again when you're creating a deep fake video using an audio coder those are things that we
can detect at the signal level at the physical level we're talking about things like lighting conditions shadows

signal physical and semantic level these are things that methods that have been used in traditional image forensics

some of the other methods to detecting defects involve inventing novel neural

at a microscopic approach which is the level that most of these complex convolutional neural networks operate at
you lose too much information so because of that you're unable to really determine whether or not a video is a
deep fake at the same time at a high level at the macroscopic level which is the level that humans operate at we have
issues detecting forgeries there's really too much information you don't know really what to focus on to detect whether or not something is a deep fake
so the hypothesis that these researchers had is that if we operate at an intermediate level at the mesoscopic
level then we should develop a model that has the best chance of detecting defects the way that the authors ended
up building out this model was to start with very complex convolutional neural network and bit by bit removed layers as

that had four convolutional layers and then two dense layers on top of it one
